ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwàʼne fóo mbwó mèŋ Pɔ̂ɔ ngàŋntúm Yěsô Keleto. E Ssé yé máŋwɛ́ zɔ la tsɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ɔn na we lekwoŋ ńdɔg ńgÿo wɛ̌. Afɛ̌ wege Sɔsetɛn aa yé ssé.
en: Paul,   called as an apostle  # 1:1 Rm 1:1 of Christ Jesus by God’s will,  # 1:1 2Co 1:1; Eph 1:1; Col 1:1; 2Tm 1:1 and Sosthenes our brother:  # 1:1 Ac 18:17

ngiemboon: N ŋweʼe ńnáa mbwó cúʼtè pʉ̀a Ssé á tÿǒsoŋo Koléŋtò, á wɔ́b gẅie e Ssé la laa wɔ́b na Yěsô Keleto, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé, ńzɛ́te mbwó pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gwɔ́ kwàʼ pʉ̀a pé. N náa yɔɔn ŋwàʼne mbɔɔ mbwó mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie aa nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ɔ, ńtóŋo lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Keleto. À lɔgɔ púʼu, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔb yɔ́b.
en: To the church of God at Corinth,   to those sanctified  # 1:2 Ac 20:32; 26:18; 1Co 6:11; Heb 10:10 in Christ Jesus, called  # 1:2 Rm 1:6–7 as saints, with all those in every place who call on the name  # 1:2 Gn 4:26; Ps 79:6; Jn 10:25; Ac 9:14; 15:14; Rv 14:1 of Jesus Christ our Lord #— #both their Lord and ours.

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto ne ńcÿó gʉm gí, ńne ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè na pi!
en: Grace to you and peace from God our Father   and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: N ne ńnáa ndǎg mbwó Ssé fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm ńtí gẅí, á na menò mbòŋo mie à ka lɔg ńcÿó gʉm gí, ńcʉa na páʼ pi lâ Yěsô Keleto kéen ńtemte.
en: I always thank   my God for you because of the grace of God given to you in Christ Jesus,

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi lâ Keleto kéen ńtemte la, e Ssé ka fǒ púʼu, ńnáa fùʼ ntsèm né pi. À ka gÿo pi kuʼu léshwóŋo nò yé, ńgíŋ ńgÿo pi kuʼu lézsé nò nénʉ́.
en: that you were enriched in him   in every way, in all speech and all knowledge.  # 1:5 Rm 15:14; 1Co 12:8; 2Co 8:7; 1Jn 2:20

ngiemboon: Á fó na páʼ mé ka shwóŋo gẅí nò gie mé zsé na Keleto, pi zẅíŋ né ntʉ́m gẅí ntsèm,
en: In this way, the testimony about Christ was confirmed among you,

ngiemboon: tà áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mbwó pi pie pi ne ńzẅíʼte fʉ̀ʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Keleto ge kẅɛ, atsɔ́ fùʼ gie á fóo mbwó Ssé, tà pi nyé ne ḿmoŋe, á té wó wɔ́.
en: so that you do not lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait   for the revelation  # 1:7 1Pt 4:13 of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Yé Yěsô Keleto ge gÿo, pi tʉte tʉte tà ńdáʼ ńcʉ́me, à láʼ ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ gie yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege, ge láʼ gíŋ tó, mé le ne ńdaʼa gẅí na tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: He will also strengthen you to the end,   so that you will be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.  # 1:8 Lk 17:24; 1Co 5:5; 2Co 1:14; Php 2:16; Col 1:22

ngiemboon: Yé Ssé gẅie à la tsɔ́ʼɔ gẅí páʼ pi ge néŋe fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm é la nnɛ́ na Míŋ we Yěsô Keleto gẅie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege, aa ntěen ńkaʼa mmó gie à ge gÿo ḿbiŋe ńkúbe wɔ́.
en: God is faithful;   you were called by him  # 1:9 Rm 8:28 into fellowship with his Son,  # 1:9 Jn 5:19; Heb 1:2; 1Jn 1:3 Jesus Christ our Lord.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌, n dɔ̌g lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Keleto ésẅíŋte gẅí ngie: Pi gẅiin tàʼ ncwò, ngie tà fàgte gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ngie pi gẅiin tàʼ ntí lesaŋá nò, ńgẅiin tàʼ nkwaŋá.
en: Now I urge you, brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree in what you say, that there be no divisions among you, and that you be united with the same understanding and the same conviction.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, n zɔɔn ńgɔɔn páʼɔɔn ńtí nue epʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ Koleye ka shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn nò na pi, ngie fàgte kéen ńkúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: For it has been reported to me about you, my brothers and sisters, by members of Chloe’s people, that there is rivalry   among you.

ngiemboon: N ka fó mǒ ńjúʼ ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńcʉ́ʼʉ shwóŋo pɔ́ na ye ntí. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwaa ne gɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ we Pɔ̂ɔ, wetsɔ̌ ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ we Apolɔ́sè. Wetsɔ̌ gwaa ne gɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ Sefásè, wetsɔ̌ ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa nyìŋ we Keleto.
en: What I am saying is this: One of you says, “I belong to Paul,” or “I belong to Apollos,”   or “I belong to Cephas,”  # 1:12 Jn 1:42 or “I belong to Christ.”  # 1:12 Mt 23:9–10

ngiemboon: Keleto aa páʼɔɔn, mbà à kéen ńgabte mbùm ye lá? Mé la kim pɔ́ Pɔ̂ɔ na tÿǒnkǐ ńtí gẅí lá? Kà pi la kẅé ntse pɔ́ na lezíŋ Pɔ̂ɔ?
en: Is Christ divided?   Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized in Paul’s name?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ ne síe Ssé á nue é té ndàʼ Ngagẅísè pɔ́ Kelisepúsè wɔ́, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi la te kẅé ntse mbwó mèŋ wɔ́.
en: I thank God  ,# 1:14 Or I am thankful that I baptized none of you except Crispus  # 1:14 Ac 18:8 and Gaius,  # 1:14 Rm 16:23

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie ngwɔ́ á gɔɔn ngie pi la kẅé ntse ńdɔgɔ púʼu, ńcʉ́ʼʉ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, à te wó wɔ́.
en: so that no one can say you were baptized in my name.

ngiemboon: Oon, n dege kɔ́, atsìŋendá Setefanásè la gíŋ ńkẅé ntse mbwó mèŋ, é té ndàʼ púʼu wɔ́, mbà n kaa gíŋ ńzsé tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi gẅie à la kẅé ntse mbwó mèŋ wɔ́.
en: I did, in fact, baptize the household   of Stephanas;  # 1:16 1Co 16:15,17 beyond that, I don’t recall if I baptized anyone else.

ngiemboon: Keleto la zɔɔn te túmo wɔ́ɔn ngie n gʉa ńgÿo epʉ̀a kẅé ntse mbwó mèŋ wɔ́. À la túmo wɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ngie n gʉa ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo. Tá ńké le lɔg pɔ́ zsénò nyìŋ mesoŋ ńtsẅi wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ légÿo ngʉ̀ʼ gie é fóo na páʼ Keleto la kwé na tÿǒnkǐ, é mag.
en: For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel #— #not with eloquent wisdom, so that the cross   of Christ will not be emptied of its effect.

ngiemboon: Mé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn nò na legwé Keleto na tÿǒnkǐ, á gwɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a pie ée na mánzsè lepyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nò ngàŋ lejÿɔ́g, táʼ, ńké ńgʉa na pege pie pege ee na mánzsè letsẅɛ́, ayɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ mbwó pege ńdaʼte pɔ́ ngʉ̀ʼ Ssé.
en: For the word of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but it is the power of God to us who are being saved.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne yé ngie: «N ge gÿo tágte zsénò pazsé nò, é pyág legye pʉ̀a pie legye sɔ́b ée wó.»
en: For it is written,

ngiemboon: Anzsènò lɔgɔ páʼɔɔn ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ nzɔ̌? Anzsè Ŋwàʼne Ssé gwɔ́ nzɔ̌? Anzòŋo nò na yɔɔn kème njÿó gwɔ́ yé nzɔ̌? E Ssé leen te gÿo azsénò tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó cʉ́ʼ menò pʉ̀a wɔ́ le?
en: Where is the one who is wise? Where is the teacher of the law?   Where is the debater of this age?  # 1:20 Lk 16:8 Hasn’t God made the world’s wisdom foolish?

ngiemboon: Áa púʼu páʼɔɔn ńtí nue pʉ̀a mesoŋ la te lɔgɔ yɔ́b zsénò, ńzsé Ssé wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ páʼ e Ssé ne shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńnyɛɛ zsénò yé. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo e Ssé záb ngie à ge gÿo epʉ̀a pie é zǎb ntʉ́m na yé, e tsẅɛ́, éfó na yɔɔn nò gie pege ne ńgɔɔn, epʉ̀a ne ńgyá ngie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ menò pʉ̀a lɔɔn.
en: For since, in God’s wisdom, the world did not know God through wisdom, God was pleased to save those who believe through the foolishness of what is preached.

ngiemboon: Pa Yúndà ée na wɔ́b nkwɔʼɔ́ ńne ńzɛ́te ngie mé nyɛɛ meliŋé mie é laʼte metʉ̀ Ssé. Epʉ̀a Ngelékiya ne ńzɛ́te mmó gie á laʼte kwàʼ zsénò.
en: For the Jews ask for signs   and the Greeks seek wisdom,

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa na peg, peg ne sáʼa pɔ́ nò Keleto gẅie mé la kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ. Ayɛ̌ nò gwɔ́ mbwó pà Yúndà ńgwɔ́ nò gie ngwɔ́ mé zɔɔn le kím tà shwóŋo nyìŋ wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menò pʉ̀a.
en: but we preach Christ crucified,   a stumbling block to the Jews and foolishness to the Gentiles.  # 1:23 Other mss read Greeks

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa mbwó pʉ̀a pie é Ssé tsɔʼɔ́ wɔ́b, kà é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pà Yúndà wɔ́ɔ, kà pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, Keleto laʼte páʼ metʉ̀ Ssé ée púʼu, mbɔɔ páʼ zsénò Ssé áa púʼu.
en: Yet to those who are called,   both Jews and Greeks, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God,

ngiemboon: Á nue ammó gie e Ssé gÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ gyá ngie áa nò pʉ̀a, azsénò áa mǒ ńcʉa gie áa na mmó gie nyìŋ mesoŋ gÿo. Ammó gie Ssé piŋ ńgÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ gyá ngie á pÿɛ pÿɛ̌, ayɛ̌ gẅiin tʉ̀ ńcʉa we shúm sie nyìŋ mesoŋ gÿo.
en: because God’s foolishness is wiser than human wisdom, and God’s weakness is stronger than human strength.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌, pi pie Ssé la tsɔ́ʼɔ gẅí, pi gyá ntí gie pi lɔg ńgwɔ́, epʉ̀a pie mé ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgyá ngie ée pazsé nò, é té tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà ńgyɔ́ɔn wɔ́. Pagẅiin metʉ̀ é té tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà ńgyɔ́ɔn wɔ́. Pafó na metsìŋendá memǎa pʉ̀a piŋ ńké te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi tà ńgyɔ́ɔn wɔ́.
en: Brothers and sisters, consider your calling: Not many were wise from a human perspective,   not many powerful,  # 1:26 Ac 25:5 not many of noble birth.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, e Ssé la tsɔ́ʼ shúm sie njÿó gyǎ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ shúm pʉ̀a, ńdɔg ńtém shʉ́ na pazsé nò, ńtsɔ́ʼɔ mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pepÿɛ́ɛ ńdɔg ńtém shʉ́ na sie é gẅiin tʉ̀.
en: Instead, God has chosen   what is foolish in the world to shame the wise, and God has chosen what is weak in the world to shame the strong.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la tsɔ́ʼɔ mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, á té tsɔ́ mmó kuʼ, ńkɔ́g kɔ́g, mé gwág gwǎg, ńdɔg ńzẅé nzẅìŋ gie mé kwǎŋ ngie áa mmó tɛʼ.
en: God has chosen what is insignificant and despised in the world    #— #what is viewed as nothing #— #to bring to nothing what is viewed as something,

ngiemboon: À cʉa púʼu, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ le ŋáʼte mvfò Ssé wɔ́.
en: so that no one   may boast in his presence.  # 1:29 Ac 7:46

ngiemboon: Yé Ssé zɔ la temte gẅí lâ Yěsô Keleto, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo yégè zsénò. E Ssé fó na yé, ńgyá wégè páʼ pate fʉa, ńdɔgɔ wégè ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé, ńzáʼ nkÿo puʼ nò tepòŋ na pege.
en: It is from him that you are in Christ Jesus, who became wisdom from God for us #— #our righteousness,   sanctification,  # 1:30 1Th 4:3 and redemption  # 1:30 Eph 1:7  #— #

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ púʼu, ńcʉ́me na nò gie Ŋwàʼne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo léŋáʼte, á lɔg pɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gÿo tá ńdɔg ńŋáʼte.»
en: in order that, as it is written:   Let the one who boasts, boast in the Lord.   # 1:31 Jr 9:24,# 1:31 Jr 9:23–24
